texts.orig: spamassassin
texts.text: spamassassin

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: One of my biggest complaints on RHEL 4 is the large resource usage by the version of SpamAssassin that is installed. When it runs, it uses a ton of CPU time and causes a lot of disk I/O as well. When running top, you may see multiple spamd processes. For a high-volume e-mail server (like the one I administer), this is simply unacceptable.
texts.text: One of my biggest complaints on RHEL 4 is the large resource usage by the version of SpamAssassin that is installed. When it runs, it uses a ton of CPU time and causes a lot of disk I/O as well. When running top, you may see multiple spamd processes. For a high-volume e-mail server (like the one I administer), this is simply unacceptable.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I decided to do something about it, and here are the steps:
texts.text: I decided to do something about it, and here are the steps:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: First,  you will need two RPMs:
texts.text: First,  you will need two RPMs:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Latest  SpamAssassin RPM from Dag
texts.text: Latest  SpamAssassin RPM from Dag

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The  psa-spamassassin RPM from SWSoft/Parallels .
texts.text: The  psa-spamassassin RPM from SWSoft/Parallels .

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Once you have them both on the server, install the new SpamAssassin package from Dag:
texts.text: Once you have them both on the server, install the new SpamAssassin package from Dag:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: # rpm -Uvh spamassassin-(version).el4.rf.(arch).rpm
texts.text: # rpm -Uvh spamassassin-(version).el4.rf.(arch).rpm

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: At this point, Plesk's spamassassin scripts will be non-functional, but the next step will fix it:
texts.text: At this point, Plesk's spamassassin scripts will be non-functional, but the next step will fix it:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: # rpm -Uvh --force psa-spamassassin-(version).(arch).rpm
texts.text: # rpm -Uvh --force psa-spamassassin-(version).(arch).rpm

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: NOTE: DO NOT REMOVE the psa-spamassassin RPM. This will begin stripping your system of all SpamAssassin configurations and it cannot be reversed!
texts.text: NOTE: DO NOT REMOVE the psa-spamassassin RPM. This will begin stripping your system of all SpamAssassin configurations and it cannot be reversed!

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Plesk's SpamAssassin scripts have been restored at this point in the process. Now, we need to do the part that really makes SpamAssassin work efficiently:
texts.text: Plesk's SpamAssassin scripts have been restored at this point in the process. Now, we need to do the part that really makes SpamAssassin work efficiently:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: # sa-update; sa-compile;
texts.text: # sa-update; sa-compile;

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This will update the SpamAssassin rules, and it will compile the rules with re2c (you may also need to  get this RPM from Dag ). This compilation means less disk access, and less CPU time being used to process e-mails.
texts.text: This will update the SpamAssassin rules, and it will compile the rules with re2c (you may also need to  get this RPM from Dag ). This compilation means less disk access, and less CPU time being used to process e-mails.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: To activate the compiled rules within SpamAssassin, uncomment the plugin line in /etc/mail/spamassassin/v320.pre:
texts.text: To activate the compiled rules within SpamAssassin, uncomment the plugin line in /etc/mail/spamassassin/v320.pre:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# Rule2XSBody - speedup by compilation of ruleset to native code
#
loadplugin Mail::SpamAssassin::Plugin::Rule2XSBody
texts.text:
# Rule2XSBody - speedup by compilation of ruleset to native code
#
loadplugin Mail::SpamAssassin::Plugin::Rule2XSBody

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Please bear in mind that this process is done  at your own risk . This may cause issues getting support from SWSoft or your hosting company. This has been tested on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4 64-bit with Plesk 8.1.1, 8.2.0, and 8.2.1 with SpamAssassin 3.2.3 and 3.2.4.
texts.text: Please bear in mind that this process is done  at your own risk . This may cause issues getting support from SWSoft or your hosting company. This has been tested on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4 64-bit with Plesk 8.1.1, 8.2.0, and 8.2.1 with SpamAssassin 3.2.3 and 3.2.4.
